alert.note: Alert for Walton (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 19 at 12:28PM EDT until June 19 at 3:45PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CDT FOR SOUTHWESTERN WALTON COUNTY... At 1127 AM CDT, a confirmed tornado was located near Santa Rosa Beach, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Damaging tornado. SOURCE...Weather spotters confirmed tornado. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. This tornadic thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of southwestern Walton County, including the following locations... Portland, Port Washington, Freeport, Bunker, Grayton Beach, Blue Mountain Beach, Seagrove Beach and Seaside. TORNADO...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN
info.instruction: To repeat, a tornado is on the ground. TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris. If a tornado or other severe weather is spotted, report it to the National Weather Service or your local nearest law enforcement agency who will send your report. This act may save lives of others in the path of dangerous weather.
